node.title: Millions of children have lost a parent or caregiver to COVID
node.description: Study's authors say their new data underscore the urgency for governments to address the pandemic's toll on orphaned children.

node.title: Massive winter storm to strike states with ice and snow
node.description: The storm system is expected to bring record-breaking low temperatures along with risks for power outages, hazardous travel and tree damage.

node.title: 'RATs demand can't be met': Pharmacies turning away customers
node.description: Pharmacies are being inundated with people keen to buy rapid antigen tests. Audio

node.title: Sanctions on Russia raise questions about space station
node.description: President Biden says new sanctions will degrade Russia's aerospace industry, "including their space program."

node.title: DWTS pro Maksim Chmerkovskiy sends emotional message from Kyiv
node.description: "There's ALWAYS another way!" Chmerkovskiy wrote Thursday. "WAR is NEVER an answer!

node.title: Former U.S. presidents respond to Russia's assault on Ukraine
node.description: Most of the former presidents called Russia's attack an assault on democracy and urged national unity.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (February 27)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: Three waters transition unit appointed
node.description: The three waters reform National Transition Unit board will be chaired by Waka Kotahi NZTA chair Sir Brian Roche, the government has announced.

node.title: Omicron phase three: Concern for vulnerable rural communities
node.description: There are fears the phase three Omicron response will see already-stretched rural health services in crisis as they try to care for increasing numbers of Covid-19 patients at home.

node.title: Verdict reached in federal civil rights trial over George Floyd's death
node.description: The jury heard four weeks of testimony in the civil rights trial of three former police officers involved in the death of George Floyd.

node.title: Ukrainian lawmaker's emotional plea as Russia attacks: "Please save our people"
node.description: "Dozens and maybe hundreds of people of mine are being murdered tonight," Ukrainian Parliament member Halyna Yanchenko told CBS News.

node.title: Covid-19: Shipment of 10 million rapid antigen tests due over weekend
node.description: The new shipment, along with tests that arrived in the last two days, will bring the country's stock to 22 million by Monday.

node.title: Timeline: From Ukraine's independence in 1991 to latest conflict
node.description: A look back at the main events in Ukraine's political history since it won independence from Moscow in 1991.

node.title: $4 per gallon gas across U.S. by April, one expert predicts
node.description: American motorists are in for at least some short-term pain at the fuel pump as oil and gas markets react to global conflict.

node.title: What to know about the Russia-Ukraine conflict as invasion begins
node.description: Vladimir Putin has launched​ what Ukrainian officials described as a "full-scale invasion" of the country, a former Soviet republic that's been independent for over 30 years.

node.title: Person in wheelchair dies after waiting 6 hours for ambulance
node.description: First Union ambulance secretary Faye McCann says it is a heart-breaking situation that has hit staff hard. Audio

node.title: Inga the Winger dies
node.description: The former All Black and rugby league player Va'aiga Tuigamala has died, aged 52.

node.title: Parties off in Dunedin as Omicron spreads among students
node.description: It's an Orientation Week like no other for hundreds of Otago University students stuck isolating with Covid or as close contacts.

node.title: Ford recalls 250,000 heavy-duty pickups for drive shaft fractures
node.description: Nearly 250,000 heavy-duty pickup trucks are recalled because their drive shafts can fracture and cause a loss of power.

node.title: Biden unveils new sanctions on Russia for "premeditated attack" on Ukraine
node.description: "Putin is the aggressor. Putin chose this war. And now he and his country will bear the consequences," Mr. Biden said."

node.title: Bledisloe Cup series reduced to two matches
node.description: The annual three-match Bledisloe Cup series between the All Blacks and Wallabies will be scaled back to two tests until at least 2025.

node.title: Omicron phase three: What you need to know
node.description: Explainer - The government has announced the country is moving to phase three - but what does that mean? RNZ is here to clear it all up.

node.title: NZ sharemarket slumps in response to Ukraine invasion
node.description: The local sharemarket has slumped to a two year low and the New Zealand dollar fallen on reports of Russian military action in Ukraine.

node.title: After five years and five attempts, Quade Cooper gets Australian citizenship
node.description: Wallabies first-five Quade Cooper received his Australian citizenship after five years and five attempts and having played 75 tests.

node.title: Rep. Michael McCaul on Russia-Ukraine crisis
node.description: President Biden has made it clear he will not send any U.S. troops into Ukraine.

node.title: Over half of U.S. abortions now done with pills, not surgery
node.description: More than half of U.S. abortions are now done with pills rather than surgery, an upward trend that spiked during the pandemic with the increase in telemedicine, a new report shows.

node.title: UEFA could move Champions League final from Russia
node.description: UEFA will move this year's Champions League final from St Petersburg in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Trump's response to Putin's invasion of Ukraine reveals GOP fissures
node.description: Republicans split on how much the U.S. should be involved in the conflict.

node.title: Nine-a-side possible at Cricket World Cup
node.description: Teams at next month's Women's Cricket World Cup in New Zealand will be able to field a side with only nine players if their squad is affected by Covid-19.

node.title: Russia attacked Ukraine with 100 missiles, 75 bombers, official says
node.description: The initial Russian barrage included ballistic, cruise and surface-to-air missiles, the U.S. official said.
